New Records: Nikola Jokic and Russell Westbrook are the first pair of teammates to record a triple-double in the same game twice in a single season.
They are also the first to record a 25-point triple-double in the same regular-season game.
Russell Westbrook had his 202nd career triple-double, which is the NBA record.
Key Match Events: Nikola Jokic returned to the game in the fourth quarter and had 9 points, 4 assists and 3 rebounds.
Brooklyn rallied to get within five, and Jokic returned to the game.
Westbrook had four assists in the fourth to record his triple-double.
Pre-Game Insights: Jokic had missed the previous two games with an illness before returning against the Nets.
Post-Match Reflections: Jokic said, 'I think it's that's the style both of us play. I'm just glad we're winning the games because that's more important than the stats.'
Westbrook credited Malone with giving him the freedom to play his game.
Westbrook said, 'Being able to do that allows me to be able to make guys around me better.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Nuggets won the game 124-105 against the Brooklyn Nets.
Others: Denver coach Michael Malone said, 'Wow, that's pretty crazy. We're watching history, folks.'
